Returns: true if the data was bound to the view, false otherwise
Parameters: View: the view to bind the data to
Object: the data to bind to the view
String: a safe String representation of the supplied data: it is either the result of data.toString() or an empty String but it is never null
setViewValue(android.view.View,java.lang.Description: Binds the specified data to the specified view. When binding is handled by this ViewBinder, this method must return true. If this method returns false, SimpleAdapter will attempts to handle the binding on its own.
setViewValue(android.view.View,java.lang.FullName: public abstract boolean setViewValue (View view, Object data, String textRepresentation)

ClassDesc: This class can be used by external clients of SimpleAdapter to bind values to views. You should use this class to bind values to views that are not directly supported by SimpleAdapter or to change the way binding occurs for views supported by SimpleAdapter.
